qas.question: What empire did Babur found in northern India?
Of what nationality was Sher Shah Suri?
At what place did Akbar's army defeat Hemu in 1556?
By what route did Babur enter India?

context: In 1526, Babur, a Timurid descendant of Timur and Genghis Khan from Fergana Valley (modern day Uzbekistan), swept across the <a4_0>Khyber Pass<a4_0/> and established the <a0_0>Mughal Empire<a0_0/>, which at its zenith covered modern day Afghanistan, Pakistan, India and Bangladesh. However, his son Humayun was defeated by the <a2_0>Afghan<a2_0/> warrior <a1_0>Sher Shah Suri<a1_0/> in the year 1540, and Humayun was forced to retreat to Kabul. After Sher Shah's death, his son Islam Shah Suri and the Hindu emperor Hemu Vikramaditya, who had won 22 battles against Afghan rebels and forces of Akbar, from Punjab to Bengal and had established a secular rule in North India from Delhi till 1556 after winning Battle of Delhi. Akbar's forces defeated and killed Hemu in the <a3_0>Second Battle of Panipat<a3_0/> on 6 November 1556.
